citeinfo.title: Salmon May Move North - Alaska Sea Grant Radio Show

descript.abstract: Last summer, residents of Alaska's Arctic Ocean coast reported seeing migrating salmon, something that no one can remember ever having seen that far north before. But as Doug Schneider reports in this week's Arctic Science Journeys Radio, scientists say a warmer climate may force salmon to look for colder water far from where they are today.
descript.purpose: When Canadian researcher David Welch began studying salmon survival in the North Pacific Ocean, he expected to find salmon throughout the sea. But the further south he went, the warmer the ocean becameï¾—and the fewer salmon he found. As he moved into waters roughly the same latitude as northern California, he didn't find any salmon at all.
